link_name: pyzlack - Zabbix to Slack written in Python 3
link_desc:
Send Zabbix alerts to Slack. Written in Python 3. Can have multiple configurations of destination/username/icon. Can send either simple messages or enriched messages.

Run 'pyzlack -h' to see parameters.

Alert body format should be:

Item:: {HOST.NAME1} | {ITEM.NAME1} | {ITEM.VALUE1}
Item:: {HOST.NAME2} | {ITEM.NAME2} | {ITEM.VALUE2}
Item:: {HOST.NAME3} | {ITEM.NAME3} | {ITEM.VALUE3}
Item:: {HOST.NAME4} | {ITEM.NAME4} | {ITEM.VALUE4}
Item:: {HOST.NAME5} | {ITEM.NAME5} | {ITEM.VALUE5}
Item:: {HOST.NAME6} | {ITEM.NAME6} | {ITEM.VALUE6}
Item:: {HOST.NAME7} | {ITEM.NAME7} | {ITEM.VALUE7}
Item:: {HOST.NAME8} | {ITEM.NAME8} | {ITEM.VALUE8}
Item:: {HOST.NAME9} | {ITEM.NAME9} | {ITEM.VALUE9}

Trigger_name:: {TRIGGER.NAME}
Trigger_description:: {TRIGGER.DESCRIPTION}
Trigger_status:: {TRIGGER.STATUS}
Trigger_severity:: {TRIGGER.SEVERITY}
Trigger_nseverity:: {TRIGGER.NSEVERITY}
Trigger_URL:: {TRIGGER.URL}
Event_ID:: {EVENT.ID}
Event_age:: {EVENT.AGE}
Event_ack:: {EVENT.ACK.STATUS}

Order of items doesn't matter.

More details on GitHub: https://github.com/bgdnlp/pyzlack
author: bgdnlp
